content: Who was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, and in 1903 she shared it with her husband Pierre and physicist Henri Becquerel?

The first woman to win a Nobel Prize was Marie Curie, and in 1903, she shared it with her husband Pierre Curie and physicist Henri Becquerel. They were awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics for their pioneering work on radioactivity. Marie Curie later went on to win a second Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1911 for her discovery of the elements polonium and radium.
